alert.note: Alert for Long (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 12:17PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Long. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1214 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated some pockets of heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing, mainly east and west of Ludowici, and can be expected elsewhere in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain has been estimated to have already fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ludowici, Tibet, Murrays Crossing and Jones Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
